article.Heading: Budget 2016: Jet, SpiceJet, InterGlobe slump on fear of 5% custom duty
article.Summary: With international oil prices slumping to 12-year low, it is being said that the government may, in the Budget next week, look at re-imposing 5 percent customs duty on crude oil imports to shore up its revenue by around Rs 18,000 crore.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Aviation stocks are reeling under pressure on fears of customs duty re-imposition. Stocks like InterGlobe Aviation, Jet Airways and SpiceJet are down 4-6 percent intraday on Monday. Investors are scared that a 5 percent customs duty on crude may be re-imposed in the Union Budget to be presented by the Finance Minister Arun Jaitley.

An association of companies has requested the government not to reimpose customs duty on crude oil saying that refineries will not be able to absorb additional costs.

With international oil prices slumping to 12-year low, it is being said that the government may, in the Budget next week, look at re-imposing 5 percent customs duty on crude oil imports to shore up its revenue by around Rs 18,000 crore.

The government had cut customs duty on crude oil imports to zero from 5 percent in June 2011 when rates zoomed to over USD 100 per barrel. But with oil prices hovering at USD 30 a barrel now, the duty may be brought back.
